decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful red spells and creatures. It aims to disrupt opponents' strategies with cards like Blood Moon and Relic of Progenitus, while also dealing direct damage with Lightning Bolt and Skred. The deck includes big red creatures like Hazoret the Fervent and Chandra, Torch of Defiance to provide additional threats. With mana acceleration from Simian Spirit Guide and ramp from cards like Koth of the Hammer, this deck looks to establish board control and ultimately overpower opponents with its big red spells and creatures.

This UW Control deck focuses on controlling the game through counter spells, removal, and card advantage. The deck aims to outlast opponents by using cards like Cryptic Command, Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, and Snapcaster Mage to control the board and maintain card advantage. It also includes a mix of removal spells like Lightning Bolt, Lightning Helix, and Path to Exile to deal with threats. The deck's win condition comes from efficiently controlling the game and eventually overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats like Celestial Colonnade or Secure the Wastes.

This deck focuses on quickly playing powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent. With a mix of disruptive spells like All Is Dust and Chalice of the Void, along with efficient mana acceleration from Urza lands and Expedition Map, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent and disrupt their game plan. Cards like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer provide both aggression and disruption, while Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger serves as a late-game finisher. The deck is all about playing big threats fast and controlling the game tempo.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and fast, efficient damage. By utilizing low-cost, high-value creatures like Goblin Guide and Kird Ape, as well as burn spells like Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. Additionally, the deck benefits from cards like Burning-Tree Emissary and Reckless Bushwhacker to swarm the board and quickly close out games. The land base is designed to support these fast plays and provide the necessary mana sources for the aggressive strategy.

This deck aims to quickly build up poison counters on the opponent through the infect mechanic, using cards like Glistener Elf and Plague Stinger supported by pump spells such as Mutagenic Growth and Become Immense. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to clear the way for the infect creatures. The key strategy revolves around efficiently maximizing the damage output of the infect creatures while protecting them with cards like Vines of Vastwood and Blossoming Defense. The deck also includes mana ramp with Noble Hierarch to ensure a quick and deadly assault.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through mana advantage and powerful spells while using the UrzaTron lands combination to ramp up quickly. The deck includes various counterspells, removal, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain card advantage. It also includes finishers like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Wurmcoil Engine to close out the game once control has been established. The deck aims to assemble the UrzaTron lands as quickly as possible to cast its high mana cost threats and take over the game.

The main concept of this Mardu Aggro deck is to quickly disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while generating token creatures with Young Pyromancer and Lingering Souls to apply pressure. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push, while also dealing direct damage with burn spells like Lightning Helix. Additionally, the deck can disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon and utilize card advantage with Bedlam Reveler and Faithless Looting.

The deck focuses on disrupting opponent's strategy while controlling the board through counter spells and removals. It utilizes cards like Cryptic Command and Snapcaster Mage to maintain card advantage and tempo. Blood Moon is included to disrupt opponent's mana base. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by efficiently trading resources and ultimately outlasting them in the late game. With access to powerful Planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, the deck can generate incremental advantage and lock down the game.

This deck focuses on setting up a powerful combo using cards like Ad Nauseam and Angel's Grace to draw through the entire library and win by either playing Laboratory Maniac or using Lightning Storm. The key strategy revolves around quickly ramping up mana with cards like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism, while ensuring protection with Pact of Negation and Phyrexian Unlife. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and go off before the opponent can disrupt the game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to ramp up lands using cards like Search for Tomorrow and Farseek in order to quickly assemble the combo of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and a large number of Mountains. Once this combo is in place, playing Scapeshift allows for a game-winning amount of damage to be dealt to the opponent. The deck also utilizes Primeval Titan to search for specific lands and accelerate the combo, while also having removal and board control tools to survive until the combo can be established.

The deck focuses on assembling the Krark-Clan Ironworks combo to generate mana and sacrifice artifacts, enabling the player to loop through their deck and bring out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck includes various artifacts and card draw spells to help find the combo pieces quickly and efficiently. It also includes control elements like Ensnaring Bridge to protect the player while they set up their win condition. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board state and win the game in a single explosive turn.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board with big red spells like Slagstorm, Anger of the Gods, and Walking Ballista. It also utilizes cards like Chalice of the Void, Ensnaring Bridge, and Blood Moon to disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck can generate fast mana with cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Pyretic Ritual to cast powerful threats like Goblin Rabblemaster and Chandra, Torch of Defiance. The overall strategy is to slow down opponents with control elements while deploying big red threats to win the game.

The deck focuses on quickly emptying your hand using cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion to discard Vengevine and Hollow One, enabling explosive starts. Skirk Prospector and Bridge from Below provide additional value by sacrificing creatures. Walking Ballista and Lightning Bolt offer removal options while Bomat Courier ensures card advantage. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with hasty threats like Goblin Bushwhacker and Hooting Mandrills, supported by the graveyard synergy of Vengevine and Bridge from Below. This deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain momentum throughout the game.

The focus of this UR Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creatures like Thing in the Ice, Kiln Fiend, and Enigma Drake, while protecting them with spells like Dive Down and Mutagenic Growth. The deck is designed to quickly deal damage to the opponent using cards like Lightning Bolt and Temur Battle Rage, with support from cantrips such as Opt, Serum Visions, and Manamorphose to ensure consistency. The inclusion of Snapcaster Mage offers additional utility and flexibility, while cards like Blood Moon and Vapor Snag provide disruptive options.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler while disrupting the opponent with cards like Thoughtseize and Stubborn Denial. It combines efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt to control the board and close out the game quickly with cards like Temur Battle Rage. The deck also utilizes graveyard synergies with cards like Thought Scour and Snapcaster Mage to generate card advantage and put pressure on the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to apply fast and relentless pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan.

The main concept of this Modern 1 vs 1 deck is to cycle through your deck quickly with cards like Street Wraith and Monstrous Carabid, while setting up to cascade into Living End using Demonic Dread or Violent Outburst. This combo allows you to cheat powerful creatures like Horror of the Broken Lands and Archfiend of Ifnir into play from your graveyard, overwhelming your opponent with a large army of creatures. Additional cards like Beast Within and Fulminator Mage provide disruption and removal to control the board and secure your victory.
